summary: Marlin Risinger III was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He appears on payroll certifications for the months of February, November, and December of 1977. The documents list his name and salary, confirming his employment during that period. The documents do not provide any specific details about his role or responsibilities within the committee.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: The significance of Marlin Risinger III lies in his employment with the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination. While the documents do not specify his role, his presence on the payroll indicates his involvement in the committee's work.
